There are many Maven plugins that are available out there and there will be ever more in the future. Making the best use of them requires the user to have a good knowledge of the exposed properties.
Mevenide can help by providing a infrastructure to help Maven Plugins to expose their properties in a easy way.

To attain that goal Maven plugins providers can declaratively plug into Mevenide preference pages. Screenshot 1 below is an example of that interaction :
Screenshot 1 PDE plugin provider
To add a new page, plugins provider have to contribute a new Eclipse plugin that use the org.mevenide.ui.preference extension point. Please refer to the extension point documentation for more details.
A template for the Genapp plugin is available in Mevenide CVS Head for quicker startup.
However we are aware that all needed informations is already availabel in the goals.xml and properties.xml documents. So in the near future we will provide a Maven plugin to automatically generate the Eclipse plugin.
